sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {3, 4}. Find the set (A △ B) × {5} and compare it with (A × {5}) △ (B × {5}). Show that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
